comments.body: (I know I'm late but) i'm about confused how this fixes the issue. This is still hardcoding localhost

Yep, I'd like to fix everything up soon (with proper tools like ConfigMap and ComponentConfig and so on).
Static pods are only run on the master, so it works. On workers kube-proxy is run manually, and the `--master` flag is set by the bash script

I'll fix it up now on the way to v1.4, but we should discuss about a general solution that is configurable and works for everyone, and move to that solution... I know there are lots of threads about that already.

Hi Lucas, I brought this issue up with Mike last week. I think part of the problem is that the bash script only runs kube-proxy on the workers if running <1.3.0-alpha.5 . I'm currently running 1.3.0-beta.1, but once beta.3 comes out with this PR maybe it'll be fixed. Though I suspect the bash script will need to be adjusted to run the kube-proxy again, since it's not in a DaemonSet any more.

See kubernetes/kube-deploy#164
When that PR is in, it will be fixed.

But we should investigate along with @mikedanese if/when we're moving kube-proxy to a DaemonSet for_all_ (or most) deployments.
